items.text: but he's off strike this time, whipping across his pads for a single to leg
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.preText: Shashank Mishra: "If only I had a penny everytime someone typed "Kholi" for "Kohli"."
items.text: and now it's Shakib's turn to flick a little single off his pads
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.preText: Adarsh : "I chuckle and admire people being insane for Virat but still not able to spell his name correctly. It KOHLI and not kholi. btw Kholi in hindi means 'to open'"
items.text: angled across Tamim, who helps the ball down to third man for one, sending it fine of Guptill at gully this time
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.preText: Scott Oldham: "Despite the surface it makes sense to me that NZ would field first following their previous performance, judging by their plans it is clear they have taken notice of SA's ineffective short ball bowling. Breaking the opening pair - whilst restricting the scoring - on a deck that is likely to remain the same throughout the day. They'll back their batsman later on particularly with Munro and Guptill coming off strong performances."
items.text: dug in halfway down by Ferguson, and it's also misdirected down the leg side. Wide called
items.shortText: Ferguson to Tamim Iqbal, 1 wide

items.preText: MARUF: "Bangladesh is slacking in run rate, going below 5 isn't good, need to see them rotate the strike more. Ones you rotate the strike, you see the ball better, read the pitch and bowlers better. The low run rate needs to be caught up to, and needs to be done soon. "
items.text: snorter! Again Ferguson digs it in, but this time the ball is directed with vim and vigour over the top of off. Tamim is fortunate to get his bat, and hands, out of the way
items.shortText: Ferguson to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: pulled, spliced, skied, caught! Ferguson stuck with the short-pitched attack, and this is another well-directed bouncer at scorching pace: 144km/h. It's too quick for Tamim, who's not quite in position to pull as the ball rushes on to him, but does so anyway. The ball takes the splice of the shot, looping simply to Boult at midwicket
items.shortText: Ferguson to Tamim Iqbal, OUT

dismissal.text: Tamim Iqbal c Boult b Ferguson 24 (58m 38b 3x4 0x6) SR: 63.15

items.preText: Here's The Might Atom himself. After that knock against SA, you'd say he's in good nick
items.text: it's straight, and Mushfiqur nurdles into the leg side
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Luke Winslade, suitably chastened: "Sorry for any confusion from my comment....Kohli is the best, daylight is second and then I'd consider King Kane. Was more trying to note that @ArjunDevgan had somehow forgotten arguably the second best batsmen in the world in his comment. "
items.text: rising outside the off stump, Mushfiqur hopping to defend to point
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Just the one slip in place, but New Zealand also have a leg gully for Mushfiqur. Expect some more short stuff
items.text: and short it is, the ball coming off the thigh pad and bouncing down to fine leg. Ferguson's bowling with some serious heat, this one clocked at 145km/h
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 leg byes

items.preText: Doug Wright: "With all this Kane Williamson v Virat Kohli it is easy to forget Ross Taylor has been averaging 72 at 87 since he his eye operation."
items.text: and yet another short one to finish the over, Mushfiqur ducking as the ball sails over him at 141km/h
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: angled across Shakib's bows, and he has a little fiddle but can't put bat to ball outside off
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: The keeper's up to the stumps now
items.text: punched back at de Grandhomme, who gets a touch on the ball before it hits the non-striker's stumps, but Mushfiqur was safely home
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: nurdled into space on the leg side, a quick single the result
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.preText: Paul Brown: "Finally some smarts...pace Kane pace...you have it, use it ."
items.text: no shot offered and he's struck on the pad! De Grandhomme bellows an appeal, but Umpire Reiffel's not interested
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full, in the channel outside off, and it's defended to cover
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Rahul Raghuwans: "For information sake, adding to Adarsh's point, Kholi in Marathi means ' Small Housing Unit'"
items.text: nudged into space in the covers, and he's called through for a quick single
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Ferguson continues. One slip in place
items.text: Mushfiqur squirts one to leg, the ball coming off the inside half of the bat, and they chance a quick single, challenging the fielder. Tight, but safe
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Bhavik: "Good one Adarsh! Just to add Kholi in Bambaiya (slang of Hindi in Mumbai) Kholi also means small room like a studio apartment! :D"
items.text: Ferguson shoots a length delivery across Shakib at 143km/h, a measured poke rolling to mid off
items.shortText: Ferguson to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: Anns Mahboob: "Lets not forget Babar Azam, who averages 60+ in the last two years! (Including hundreds against Australia, England and South Africa!)"
items.text: rising towards his hip this time, at 142km/h, Shakib hurrying a glance to leg for one
items.shortText: Ferguson to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: that's a jaffa! Ferguson storms to the wicket and delivers a 145km/h thunderbolt that leaps past Mushfiqur's groping outside edge. He didn't know too much about that ...
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: and now, to keep him honest, a bouncer that rises over leg stump. 'One for the over' says Oxenford
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Vanja Patrakar: "Adding to Kholi meaning debate - it means small river in Nepali !"
items.text: full and straight this time, Mushfiqur driving back towards the bowler, who lets it through his hands. But mid off cleans up, and there's no single to be had
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Latham's back up to the stumps for the left hander
items.text: some shape in to the batsman, who tucks to leg
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: full, and pushed across him this time. Shakib drives to mid off, and there's room for a scampered single
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.preText: paddy: "@Luke Winslade, I still rate KW ahead of daylight"
items.text: a bit of cut back in off the track, and Mushfiqur taps it watchfully to leg
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run
